title: ISSS608-VAA-Min
text: Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Application. In this website, you will find my coursework prepared for this course.

title: Hands-on Exercise 2
text:
pacman::p_load(ggrepel, patchwork, ggthemes, hrbrthemes, tidyverse)




exam_data <- read.csv("Exam_data.csv")

title: Hands-on Exercise 2
text: exam_data <- read.csv("Exam_data.csv")

title: Hands-on Exercise 2
text:
Working without ggrepel

ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = lm, size=0.5) + geom_label(aes(label = ID), hjust = .5, vjust = -.5) + coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100), ylim = c(0,100)) + ggtitle("English Scores Vs Maths Scores for Primary 3")

title: Hands-on Exercise 2
text:
Working with ggrepel

ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = lm, size=0.5) + geom_label_repel(aes(label = ID), fontface = "bold") + coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100), ylim = c(0,100)) + ggtitle("English Scores Vs Maths Scores for Primary 3")

title: Hands-on Exercise 2
text:
Using ggplot2 themes

ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x=MATHS)) + geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25", fill = "grey90") + theme_linedraw() + ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

title: Hands-on Exercise 2
text:
Working with ggtheme package

ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=ENGLISH)) + geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25", fill= "grey90")+ ggtitle("Distribution of English Scores") + theme_solarized()

title: Hands-on Exercise 2
text:
Working with hrbthemes package

ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=ENGLISH)) + geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25", fill= "grey90")+ ggtitle("Distribution of English Scores") + theme_ipsum_inter()









ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=ENGLISH)) + geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25", fill= "grey90")+ ggtitle("Distribution of English Scores") + theme_ipsum_inter(axis_title_size = 18, base_size = 15, grid = "Y")

title: Hands-on Exercise 2
text:
Creating Composite Graphics: pathwork methods

Tow-Column layout can use Plus Sign +
Parenthesis () are used to create subplot group
Two-Row layout can use Devision Sign /


Combining two ggplot2 graphs

p1 + p2










Combining three ggplot2 graphs
“|” is to place the plots beside each other

(p1 / p2) | p3










Creating a composite figure with tag

((p1 / p2) | p3) + plot_annotation(tag_levels =  'I')










Creating figure with insert

p3 + inset_element(p2, left = 0.02, bottom = 0.7, right = 0.5, top = 1)










Creating a composite figure by using patchwork and ggtheme

patchwork <- (p1 / p2) | p3 
patchwork & theme_economist()

text:

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below use p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below use p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text: exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2:

ggplot(data = exam_data)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2

ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x=MATHS))

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom_bar

ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x=CLASS)) + geom_bar()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom_dotplot

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(dotsize = 0.5) + scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom_histogram()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Modifying a geometric object by changing geom()
text:
Modifying a geometric object by changing geom()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20,            
                 color="black",      
                 fill="light cyan")

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Modifying a geometric object by changing aes()
text:
Modifying a geometric object by changing aes()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           fill = RACE)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="grey30") + scale_fill_manual(values = c("Chinese" = "red", 
                               "Malay" = "skyblue", 
                               "Indian" = "lightgreen", 
                               "Others" = "purple"))

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom-density()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_density()           









ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = ENGLISH, 
           colour = GENDER)) +
  geom_density()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom_boxplot

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS,       
           x= GENDER)) +    
  geom_boxplot()            









ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot(notch=TRUE)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom_violin

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = ENGLISH, 
           x= RACE)) +
  geom_violin()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom_point()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y= SCIENCE)) +
  geom_point()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
geom objects can be combined

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= RACE)) +
  geom_boxplot() +                    
  geom_point(position="jitter", 
             size = 0.5)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Working with stat() - the stat_summary() method
text:
Working with stat() - the stat_summary() method

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",      
               fun = "mean",        
               colour ="red",       
               size=4)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Working with stat - the geom() method
text:
Working with stat - the geom() method

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary",        
             fun="mean",           
             colour="red",          
             size=4)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Adding a best fit curve on a scatterplot
text:
Adding a best fit curve on a scatterplot

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, linewidth=0.5)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Working with facet_wrap()

ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x=ENGLISH)) + geom_histogram(bins = 20) + facet_wrap(~ CLASS)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
facet_grid() function

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20) +
    facet_grid(~ CLASS)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Working with Coordinate

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() + coord_flip()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Changing the y- and x-axis range
text:
Changing the y- and x-axis range

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Working with theme
Using theme_classic()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_classic()








Using theme_minimal()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal()

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
ggiraph for making ‘ggplot’ graphics interactive.
plotly R library for plotting interactive statistical graphs.
DT provides R interface to the JavaScript library. DataTables that create interactive table on html page.
patchwork for combining multiple ggplot2 graphs into one figure.

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
Tooltip effect with tooltip aesthetics

p <- ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive(aes(tooltip = ID), stackgroups = TRUE, binwidth = 1, method = "histodot") +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL)
girafe(
  ggobj = p,
  width_svg = 6,
  height_svg = 6*0.618
)






p <- ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive(aes(tooltip = ID, data_id = ID), stackgroups = TRUE, binwidth = 1, method = "histodot") +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL)
girafe(
  ggobj = p,
  width_svg = 6,
  height_svg = 6*0.618
)

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
Displaying Multiple Information on tooltip

exam_data$tooltip <- paste0(     
  "Name = ", exam_data$ID,   "\n Class = ", exam_data$CLASS, "\n Race = ", exam_data$RACE) 

p <- ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive( aes(tooltip = exam_data$tooltip), 
    stackgroups = TRUE,
    binwidth = 1,
    method = "histodot") +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL)
girafe(
  ggobj = p,
  width_svg = 8,
  height_svg = 8*0.618
)

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
Displaying statistics on tooltip

tooltip <- function(y, ymax, accuracy = .01) {
  mean <- scales::number(y, accuracy = accuracy)
  sem <- scales::number(ymax - y, accuracy = accuracy)
  paste("Mean maths scores:", mean, "+/-", sem)
}

gg_point <- ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = RACE)) +
  stat_summary(aes(y = MATHS, tooltip = after_stat( tooltip(y, ymax))),  
    fun.data = "mean_se", 
    geom = GeomInteractiveCol, fill = "light green") +
  stat_summary(aes(y = MATHS), fun.data = mean_se, geom = "errorbar", width = 0.2, size = 0.2)

girafe(ggobj = gg_point,
       width_svg = 8,
       height_svg = 8*0.618)

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
Hover effect with data_id aesthetic

p <- ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive( aes(data_id = RACE), stackgroups = TRUE, binwidth = 1, method = "histodot") +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL)
girafe(                   
  ggobj = p,              
  width_svg = 6,        
  height_svg = 6*0.618)






Styling hover effect

p <- ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive( aes(data_id = RACE), stackgroups = TRUE, binwidth = 1, method = "histodot") +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL)
girafe(                   
  ggobj = p,              
  width_svg = 6,        
  height_svg = 6*0.618,
  options = list(
    opts_hover(css = "fill: red;"),
    opts_hover_inv(css = "opacity:0.2;")))

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
Combining tooltip and hover effect

p <- ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS, fill = RACE)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive( aes(tooltip = RACE, data_id = RACE), stackgroups = TRUE, binwidth = 1, method = "histodot") +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL)
girafe(                   
  ggobj = p,              
  width_svg = 6,        
  height_svg = 6*0.618,
  options = list(
    opts_hover(css = "stroke: black;"),
    opts_hover_inv(css = "opacity:0.2;")))

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
Click effect with onclick

exam_data$onclick <- sprintf("window.open(\"%s%s\")", 
                             "https://www.moe.gov.sg/schoolfinder?journey=Primary%20school", 
   as.character(exam_data$ID))
p <- ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive( aes(onclick = onclick), stackgroups = TRUE, binwidth = 1, method = "histodot") +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL)
girafe(                   
  ggobj = p,              
  width_svg = 6,        
  height_svg = 6*0.618)

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
Coordinated Multiple Views with ggiraph

p1 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive( aes(data_id = RACE), stackgroups = TRUE, binwidth = 1, method = "histodot") +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL)

p2 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_dotplot_interactive( aes(data_id = RACE), stackgroups = TRUE, binwidth = 1, method = "histodot") +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL)


girafe(                   
  code = print(p1 + p2),
  width_svg = 6,        
  height_svg = 3,
  options = list(
    opts_hover(css = "fill: red;"),
    opts_hover_inv(css = "opacity:0.2;")))

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
Using plot_ly()

plot_ly(data = exam_data, 
             x = ~MATHS, 
             y = ~ENGLISH,
            color = ~RACE)

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
Using ggplotly()

p <- ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point(size=1) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),ylim=c(0,100))
ggplotly(p)

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
Coordinated Multiple Views with ggplotly()

d <- highlight_key(exam_data)
p1 <- ggplot(data=d, 
            aes(x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point(size=1) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100), ylim=c(0,100))

p2 <- ggplot(data=d, 
            aes(x = MATHS, y = SCIENCE)) +
  geom_point(size=1) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100), ylim=c(0,100))

subplot(ggplotly(p1),
        ggplotly(p2))

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
DT package

DT::datatable(exam_data, class= "compact")

title: Hands-on Exercise 3.1
text:
Linked brushing: crosstalk method

d <- highlight_key(exam_data) 
p <- ggplot(d, aes(ENGLISH, MATHS)) + 
  geom_point(size=1) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100), ylim=c(0,100))

gg <- highlight(ggplotly(p),"plotly_selected")  

crosstalk::bscols(gg, DT::datatable(d),widths = 5)
